channel.title: International Relations on PepsFeeder
channel.description: Recent content in International Relations on PepsFeeder

item.title: U.N. Passes Gaza Cease-Fire Resolution as Blinken Presses Israel and Hamas
item.description: The United Nations Security Council on Friday passed a resolution calling for a cease-fire in the Gaza conflict, as Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken spoke with Israeli and Palestinian leaders and urged an end to the violence.

item.title: Flemish Nationalists Thwart Ascent of Secessionist Party in Belgian Elections
item.description: By J. D. Longstreet The Flemish Nationalists, in Belgium, have thwarted the ascent of a secessionist party in the Belgian elections. The Flemish Nationalists, who are the largest party in the Flemish region of Belgium, have been able to keep the secessionist party, the New Flemish Alliance (N-VA), from gaining a majority in the Flemish parliament.

item.title: British Leader Apologizes for Leaving D-Day Commemoration Early
item.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson apologized on Tuesday for leaving a D-Day commemoration ceremony early, saying he had been suffering from a “bit of a cold.

item.title: The E.U. Is Voting. It’s Never Mattered More.
item.description: The European Union is holding its first-ever direct elections for the European Parliament. The results will determine the direction of the 27-nation bloc for the next five years.

item.title: Biden Will Link Fight for Ukraine With Allied Effort on D-Day
item.description: President Biden will use a speech in Normandy on Thursday to link the United States’ commitment to Ukraine with the Allied victory in World War II, arguing that the United States must continue to stand up for democracy and freedom around the world.

item.title: D-Day at 80
item.description: : The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy D-Day at 80: The Battle of Normandy

item.title: A Surging Hard Right in Europe Stumbles Over Its Own Divisions
item.description: The European Union is facing a crisis of legitimacy, with the rise of populist, nationalist parties that are challenging the very foundations of the bloc. These parties, which have gained significant ground in recent years, are united by their opposition to immigration, their skepticism of globalization, and their rejection of the EU’s institutions and values.
